message.content: This question requires an understanding of how water flows on a slope. Gravity pulls water downhill, so if the land is sloped to the right, the river will flow in the same direction, which is to the right. Option (A) is incorrect because pollution is not related to the direction of water flow. Option (C) is unrelated to the question and refers to the variety of living organisms in an area. Option (D) is incorrect because if the land is sloped to the right, the river will not flow to the left.

This question requires a basic understanding of how gravity affects the flow of water. Water always flows downhill due to the force of gravity. In this scenario, if the land is sloped to the right and there is a body of water on that slope, the river will flow in the direction of the slope, which is to the right. Option (A) is incorrect because it is unrelated to the flow of the river. Option (C) is unrelated to the scenario and is talking about species. Option (D) is incorrect because it goes against the natural flow of water.
